titleInfo.title: Letter no.3576 of 1854 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, enclosing an extract of paragraph 43 from a despatch from the Honourable Court of Directors (folio 292), dated 27 April 1854. The extract relates to how the payment of damages to the victims of acts of piracy in the Gulf should be made. The proposal by Government is to make payments directly to the victims rather than to their chiefs, a decision which Shaikh Sooltan bin Suggar [Sultan bin Saqr] of Shargah has rejected.
